#summary Collection of GLVis screenshots
#labels Featured

This page collects screenshots from various simulations that have used GLVis visualization. Additional images can be found in the  [https://code.google.com/p/mfem/wiki/Gallery MFEM Gallery].

----

[http://images.glvis.googlecode.com/hg/logo-gallery-full.png http://images.glvis.googlecode.com/hg/logo-gallery.png]

_The GLVis logo is derived from the [http://www.bathsheba.com/downloads/metatron.zip Metatron model] at [http://www.bathsheba.com bathsheba.com]. Shown is the magnitude of the projection of a smooth vector field using 4th order Nedelec elements on a second order curved tehrahedral mesh (based on MFEM's [http://doxygen.mfem.googlecode.com/hg/html/ex3_8cpp_source.html Example 3])._

----

[https://computation.llnl.gov/project/blast/triple-pt/triple-pt-np128.gif https://computation.llnl.gov/project/blast/images/triple-point_BLAST_q8q7.png]

_Curvilinear 8th order mesh from a triple-point shock simulation in the MFEM-based  [http://www.llnl.gov/casc/blast BLAST] shock hydrodynamics code. Click for a movie of the evolution of the processor partitioning from a high-resolution parallel run of the problem produced with a [https://code.google.com/p/glvis/wiki/OptionsAndUse#GLVis_scripts GLVis script]._

----

https://computation.llnl.gov/casc/blast/triple-pt/triple-pt-rz-2-web.png

_Axisymmetric problem with revolved 2D mesh and solution, plus [http://code.google.com/p/glvis/wiki/OptionsAndUse#Visualizing_functions coloring grid functions] emphasizing mesh elements._

----

[http://computation.llnl.gov/ http://images.glvis.googlecode.com/hg/tp-3d-ale-black.png]

_3D Arbitrary Lagrangian-Eulerian (ALE) simulation of a shock-triple point interaction with Q2-Q1 elements in the MFEM-based [http://www.llnl.gov/casc/blast BLAST] shock hydrodynamics code. Shown are the cutting plane and level surface capabilities of GLVis._

http://glvis.googlecode.com/files/q8.png

_One of the eight order (Q8) basis functions on the reference square. The sub-refinement in GLVis (key 'i') allows for the correct visualization of such high-order functions._

http://glvis.googlecode.com/files/ball-nurbs-np16.png

_Unstructured parallel decomposition of a [http://code.google.com/p/mfem/source/browse/data/ball-nurbs.mesh fourth order NURBS mesh] of the unit ball obtained in the solution of MFEM's parallel [http://code.google.com/p/mfem/source/browse/examples/ex1p.cpp Example 1] on 16 processors._

http://glvis.googlecode.com/files/CSE13logo.jpeg

_The [http://www.siam.org/meetings/cse13 SIAM CSE13] logo illustrates the decomposition of a hexahedral zone in tetrahedral "sides". This and related images can be found in [http://dx.doi.org/10.1137/100801640 this paper]._
